metadata.title: CVE-2020-27782 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Undertow AJP connector. Malicious requests and abrupt connection closes could be triggered by an attacker using query strings with non-RFC compliant characters resulting in a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. This affects Undertow 2.1.5.SP1, 2.0.33.SP2, and 2.2.3.SP1.

criterions.comment: undertow package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
